name: Line
comment:
Line class provides static functions to create and operate on lines. A line is usually represented as a Group of 2 Pts.
You can use the static functions as-is, or apply the [`Group.op`](#link) or [`Pt.op`](#link) to enable functional programming.
See [Op guide](../guide/Op-0400.html) for details.

signatures.comment: Check if three Pts are collinear, ie, on the same straight path.

parameters.name: p1
parameters.comment: first Pt

parameters.name: p2
parameters.comment: second Pt

parameters.name: p3
parameters.comment: third Pt

parameters.name: threshold
parameters.comment: a threshold where a smaller value means higher precision threshold for the straight line. Default is 0.01.

signatures.comment: Crop this line by a circle or rectangle at end points. This can be useful for creating arrows that connect to an object's edge.
signatures.returns_comment: an intersecting point on the line that can be used for cropping.

parameters.name: line
parameters.comment: a Group or an Iterable<Pt> representing a line to crop

parameters.name: size
parameters.comment: size of circle or rectangle as Pt

parameters.name: index
parameters.comment: line's end point index, ie, 0 = start and 1 = end.

parameters.name: cropAsCircle
parameters.comment: a boolean to specify whether the `size` parameter should be treated as circle. Default is `true`.

signatures.comment: Given a line and a point, find the shortest distance from the point to the line.

parameters.name: line
parameters.comment: a Group of 2 Pts

parameters.name: pt
parameters.comment: a Pt

signatures.comment: Create a line that originates from an anchor point, given an angle and a magnitude.
signatures.returns_comment: a Group of 2 Pts representing a line segement

parameters.name: anchor
parameters.comment: an anchor Pt

parameters.name: angle
parameters.comment: an angle in radian

parameters.name: magnitude
parameters.comment: magnitude of the line

signatures.comment: Calculate the slope and xy intercepts of a line.

parameters.name: p1
parameters.comment: line's first end point

parameters.name: p2
parameters.comment: line's second end point

signatures.comment: Get two intersection Pts of a line segment with a 2D grid point.
signatures.returns_comment: a group of two intersecting Pts. The first one is horizontal intersection and the second one is vertical intersection.

parameters.name: line
parameters.comment: a ray specified by 2 Pts

parameters.name: gridPt
parameters.comment: a Pt on the grid

signatures.comment: Get two points of a ray that intersects with a point on a 2D grid.
signatures.returns_comment: a group of two intersecting Pts. The first one is horizontal intersection and the second one is vertical intersection.

parameters.name: ray
parameters.comment: a Group or an Iterable<Pt> representing a ray

parameters.name: gridPt
parameters.comment: a Pt on the grid

signatures.comment: Given two line segemnts, find their intersection point if any.
signatures.returns_comment: an intersection Pt or undefined if no intersection

parameters.name: la
parameters.comment: a Group or an Iterable<Pt> with 2 Pt representing a line segment

parameters.name: lb
parameters.comment: a Group or an Iterable<Pt> with 2 Pt representing a line segment

signatures.comment: Given a line segemnt and a ray (infinite line), find their intersection point if any.
signatures.returns_comment: an intersection Pt or undefined if no intersection

parameters.name: line
parameters.comment: a Group of 2 Pts representing a line segment

parameters.name: ray
parameters.comment: a Group of 2 Pts representing a ray

signatures.comment: Find intersection points of 2 sets of lines. This checks all line segments in the two lists. Consider using a bounding-box check before calling this. If you are checking convex polygon intersections, using [`Polygon.intersectPolygon2D`](#link) will be more efficient.

parameters.name: lines1
parameters.comment: an Array/Iterable of (Groups or Iterables<Pt>)

parameters.name: lines2
parameters.comment: an Array/Iterable of (Groups or Iterables<Pt>)

parameters.name: isRay
parameters.comment: a boolean value to treat the line as a ray (infinite line). Default is `false`.

signatures.comment: Given a line segemnt or a ray (infinite line), find its intersection point(s) with a polygon.

parameters.name: lineOrRay
parameters.comment: a Group or an Iterable<Pt> with 2 Pt representing a line or ray

parameters.name: poly
parameters.comment: a Group or an Iterable<Pt> representing a polygon

parameters.name: sourceIsRay
parameters.comment: a boolean value to treat the line as a ray (infinite line). Default is `false`.

signatures.comment: Given two lines as rays (infinite lines), find their intersection point if any.
signatures.returns_comment: an intersection Pt or undefined if no intersection

parameters.name: la
parameters.comment: a Group or an Iterable<Pt> with 2 Pt representing a ray

parameters.name: lb
parameters.comment: a Group or an Iterable<Pt> with 2 Pts representing another ray

signatures.comment: An easy way to get rectangle-line intersection points. For more optimized implementation, store the rectangle's sides separately (eg, `Rectangle.sides()`) and use `Polygon.intersectPolygon2D()`.

parameters.name: line
parameters.comment: a Group representing a line

parameters.name: rect
parameters.comment: a Group representing a rectangle

parameters.name: line
parameters.comment: a Group or an Iterable<Pt> with at least 2 Pt

signatures.comment: Get squared magnitude of a line segment.
Create an marker arrow or line, placed at an end point of this line.
signatures.returns_comment: a Group that defines the marker's shape

parameters.name: line
parameters.comment: a Group or an Iterable<Pt> representing a line to place marker

parameters.name: size
parameters.comment: size of the marker as Pt

parameters.name: graphic
parameters.comment: either "arrow" or "line"

parameters.name: atTail
parameters.comment: a boolean, if `true`, the marker will be positioned at tail of the line (ie, index = 1). Default is `true`.

signatures.comment: Find a point on a line that is perpendicular (shortest distance) to a target point.
signatures.returns_comment: a Pt on the line that is perpendicular to the target Pt, or a projection vector if `asProjection` is true.

parameters.name: line
parameters.comment: a Group or an Iterable<Pt> that defines a line

parameters.name: pt
parameters.comment: a target Pt

parameters.name: asProjection
parameters.comment: if true, this returns the projection vector instead. Default is false.

signatures.comment: Given a 2D path and a point, find whether the point is on left or right side of the line.
signatures.returns_comment: a negative value if on left and a positive value if on right. If collinear, then the return value is 0.

parameters.name: line
parameters.comment: a Group or an Iterable<PtLike> representing a line

parameters.name: pt
parameters.comment: a Pt or numeric array

signatures.comment: Calculate the slope of a line.

parameters.name: p1
parameters.comment: line's first end point

parameters.comment: line's second end point

parameters.name: line
parameters.comment: a Group or an Iterable<PtLike> representing a line

parameters.name: num
parameters.comment: number of points to get
